ovdesc.p: This table is used to store and maintain the loan information related to US Credit bureau reporting

desc.p: This field is used to store the Account status code as per metro2 format of Credit bureau reporting
This field is used to store Payment ratings based on overdue status as per metro2 format of Credit bureau reporting

valid codes are: 0 - Current account (0 to 29 days past the due date) 1 - 30-59 days past the due date 2 - 60-89 days past the due date 3 - 90-119 days past the due date 4 - 120-149 days past the due date 5 - 150-179 days past the due date 6 - 180 or more days past the due date G - Collection L - Charge-off
This field is used to enter the legal compliance code as mentioned by Fair Credit Reporting Act(FRCA)

For account status codes 64 and 97(all portfolio types), this field is used to store the original amount charged to loss, regardless of the declining balance in the current balance and amount past due
This field is used to store AA loan application date
Standard date format.
This field is used to specify the type of loan: whether loan is a conventional loan or non-conventional loan
valid codes are: 1 (Conventional) 2 (FHA) 3 (VA) 4 (FSA/RHS)
This field is used to specify Reflects whether the property is single family or multi family or manufactured house
valid codes are: 1 (1 to 4 Family) 2 (Manufactured Housing) 3 (Multifamily)
This field is used to specify purpose of Loan
valid codes are: 1 (Home Purchase) 2 (Home Improvement) 3 (Refinance)
This field is used to specify whether the property is being used for owner occupation or not
valid codes are: 1 (Principal Dwelling) 2 (Not Owner Occupied) 3 (Not Applicable)
This field is used to specify whether the loan is pre-approved or not
valid codes are: 1(Requested) 2(Not requested) 3(Not applicable)
This field is used to show the ethnicity group for which an applicant belongs to.
valid codes are: 1(Hispanic or Latino) 2(Not Hispanic or Latino) 3(Not Provided) 4(Not Applicable) 5(No Co-Applicant)
This field is used to show the ethnicity group for which an co-applicant belongs to.
valid codes are: 1(Hispanic or Latino) 2(Not Hispanic or Latino) 3(Not Provided) 4(Not Applicable) 5(No Co-Applicant)
This field is used to show the race of an applicant.
valid codes are: 1(American Indian or Alaska native) 2(Asian) 3(Black or African American) 4(Native Hawaiian or Pacific Islander) 5(White) 6(Not Provided) 7(Not Applicable) 8(No Co-Applicant)
This field is used to show the race of an co-applicant.
valid codes are: 1(American Indian or Alaska native) 2(Asian) 3(Black or African American) 4(Native Hawaiian or Pacific Islander) 5(White) 6(Not Provided) 7(Not Applicable) 8(No Co-Applicant)
This field is used to store the loan purchase type: whether it is originated or sold or from secondary market investors etc.

valid codes are: 0(Not originated or sold in calendar year) 1(Fannie Mae) 2(Ginnie Mae) 3(Freddie Mac) 4(Farmer Mac) 5(Private Securitization) 6(Commercial Bank, Savings Bank or Association) 7(Life Ins Co; CU; Mtg. Bank or finance company) 8(Affiliate) 9(Other)
This field is used to specify whether the loan is applicable for Home Ownership Equity and Protection Act or not
valid codes are: 1(HOEPA loan) 2(Not a HOEPA loan)
This field is used to specify the loan lien status on the loan property
valid codes are: 1(First Lien) 2(Subordinate Lien) 3(No Lien) 4(Not Applicable)
This field is used to indicate if the arrangement is considered to be a troubled debt restructure.
valid codes are: 1 (Y) 2 (N)
